result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph M Koch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Revoked (Misdemeanor)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $150 fine plus costs. 60 days to pay fine/costs to avoid serving jail time.

Stayed. If defendant pays fine and costs in full on or before 4/08/16, stay will be permanent. If defendant fails to pay fine and costs in full on or before 4/08/16, stay will be lifted and defendant will need to serve the 5 day sentence. Good time and huber privileges granted. 60 days from sentencing date to report.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

supervisions.notes: $100 fine plus costs. 60 days to pay fine/costs to avoid serving an additional 18 days jail.

18 days Stayed. Consecutive to Ct. 1. If defendant pays fine and costs in full on or before 4/08/16, stay will be permanent. If defendant fails to pay fine and costs in full on or before 4/08/16, stay will be lifted and defendant will need to serve the remaining 18 day sentence. Good time and huber privileges granted.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph M Koch

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joseph M Koch in court with attorney Timothy G. Duffy.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to Cts. 1 & 2. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 2. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Joseph M Koch in court with attorney Timothy G. Duffy.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Joseph M Koch in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defendant indicates he's partially paid the retainer fee for his attorney, has had some medical issues so he just recently went back to work. Defendant requests short adjournment to pay remainder of retainer fee. State concerned that this case is 7 months old and we haven't done anything on it. Court grants adjournment but indicates this case needs to move forward the next time we're in court. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joseph M Koch in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defendant is in the process of retaining Atty Tim Duffy, requests 30 day adjournment to pay the retainer fee to Atty Duffy. State has no objection to adjournment. Court indicates we need to see some movement on this case. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joseph M Koch in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defendant is looking at retaining an atty, asks court to set matter off until September as he will be having some surgery. State withdraws their offer. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 11:45 am.

Defendant Joseph M Koch in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions defendant on where he's at in retaining an atty. Defendant has his license back now, not sure how that will factor into the case. Court explains options regarding legal representation with defendant.   Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel.  Court questions Defendant, finds defendant competent to proceed, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Defendant to make appointment with DA.  Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 11:45 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 4/20/15 by Officer Bilodeau. (fingerprint card destroyed 2/11/16)
Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Joseph M Koch in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant requests time to retain an attorney. Court reschedules. Bond set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Joseph M Koch
Current: 1437 Dousman Street, Green Bay, WI 54303 United States  (Effective: 04-20-2015)
Prior: 1606B Oregon St, Oshkosh, WI 54902
